page.title: 02 Broomhead Reservoir
page.content: Broomhead Reservoir Broomhead Reservoir is situated on the northern boundary of our area. It is in the Ewden Valley. The Ewden Beck flows into the River Don. It is eight miles from the centre of Sheffield. It was built in 1929 and is about 195 metres above sea level. The surface area is 123 acres. Its greatest depth is about 30 metres and it can hold 1082 million gallons of water. Geological difficulties were encountered during construction requiring the removal of a slipping hillside on the north, the digging of deep trenches and filling underground fissures with cement. The site is kept under constant observation by the Water Board. The area surronding the reservoir has been planted with coniferous trees.
